questions.questionText: Control surface flutter:
options: A. provides additional lift for take off and landing in the event of engine failure.
B. occurs at high angles of attack.
C. is a destructive vibration that must be damped out within the flight envelope.
D. is a means of predicting the critical safe life of the wing.

questions.questionText: The primary purpose of a hydraulic reservoir is:
options: A. to compensate for leaks, displacement and expansion.
B. to allow a space into which spare fluid may be stored.
C. to indicate system contents.
D. to maintain fluid between a jack and the accumulator.

questions.questionText: The control surface which gives longitudinal control is:
options: A. the rudder
B. the ailerons
C. the elevators
D. the flaps

questions.questionText: A hand pump is usually fitted:
options: A. for ground servicing purposes.
B. lowering the landing gear in an emergency.
C. pressurising the oleo struts in the air.
D. retracting the gear after take-off.

questions.questionText: The nucleus of an atom is:
options: A. positively charged.
B. negatively charged.
C. statically charged.
D. of zero potential.

questions.questionText: Materials containing 'free electrons' are called:
options: A. insulators
B. resistors
C. collectors
D. conductors

questions.questionText: The unit of EMF is the
options: A. Ampere
B. Volt
C. Watt
D. Ohm

questions.questionText: Control overbalance results in:
options: A. a sudden increase in stick force
B. a sudden reduction then reversal of stick force
C. a sudden loss of effectiveness of the controls
D. a gradual increase in stick force with increasing IAS

questions.questionText: The primary function of a diffuser in a carburettor is to:
options: A. Control the mixture strength over part of the engine speed range.
B. Vent air from the float chamber.
C. Emulsify the fuel during engine acceleration.
D. Enable adjustment of the engine slow running speed.

questions.questionText: At what speed does an oblique shock wave move over the earth surface?
options: A. Aircraft ground speed
B. The TAS of the aircraft plus the wind speed
C. The TAS of the aircraft less the wind speed
D. The TAS relative to the speed of sound at sea level

questions.questionText: A shuttle valve is used to
options: A. Restrict the rate of operation of a system
B. Select the most suitable system pressure
C. Allow two supplies to be available to a service
D. To allow a constant volume pump to idle

questions.questionText: VLO is defined as:
options: A. Actual speed that the aircraft lifts off the ground.
B. Minimum possible speed that the aircraft could lift off the ground.
C. The maximum speed for landing gear operation
D. The long range cruise speed.

questions.questionText: The function of Shut off valve in a pneumatic system is to:
options: A. Shut Off the pneumatic system
B. To switch off bleed air supply from an engine and the APU
C. To regulate the supply of bleed air

questions.questionText: Secondary cells can:
options: A. Not be recharged
B. Can be discharged and recharged many times over a long period of time
C. Can be recharged only once

questions.questionText: Swept back and Delta wings are:
options: A. Very efficient at high speed but corresponding inefficient at low speeds
B. Fairly inefficient at high speed but very efficient at low speed
C. Neither efficient at low or high speed

questions.questionText: Nucleus has a:
options: A. Positive charge
B. Negative charge
C. Positive & Negative

questions.questionText: As per Bernoulli's theorem
options: A. Decrease in speed along a stream line point decreases static pressure
B. Increase in speed at a point along stream line, Cause a decrease in static pressure at the point
C. Increase or Decrease in speed has no change in static pressure

questions.questionText: Because of the reduction in density of the atmosphere, with an increase in altitude:
options: A. The octane rating of the fuel must be increases
B. The throttle must be reduced to maintain the best Air/Fuel ratio
C. The mixture control must be moved towards the weak position

questions.questionText: Electrical resistance is measured in:
options: A. Ohm
B. watt
C. Amp

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of a hydraulic reservoir?
options: A. To convert hydraulic pressure into work
B. To store hydraulic fluid
C. To support the system with pressurised fluid

questions.questionText: When an A/c structure is designed according to fail safe philosophy it means
options: A. The structure will never break regardless of stress applied
B. The failed structure can be replaced easily
C. Adjacent structure with stands the loads which the failed structure should have carried

questions.questionText: Control locks are used to prevent:
options: A. Controls from wear and tear
B. Unauthorised interference with them
C. Mechanical damage in strong and gusty winds

questions.questionText: Choose the correct statement, Taper ratio is:
options: A. Ratio of average chord to root chord
B. Ratio of root chord to tip chord
C. Ratio of tip chord to root chord

questions.questionText: The on load/nominal voltage of each cell of a lead acid battery is -and on load voltage of one cell of Ni-Cad battery is:
options: A. 1.27 Volts /1.24 Volts
B. 2.0 Volts/1.27 Volts
C. 2.0 Volts/1.2 volts

questions.questionText: The altitude above which icing does not occur since the droplets are all frozen and will not adhere to the aircrafts surface is:
Factor affecting the resistance
options: A. Type of material
B. Longer wire will have less resistance
C. Thicker the wire higher the resistance

questions.questionText: Class D compartment (which can not be reached by a crew inflight)
options: A. Cabin crew operated fire extinguisher
B. Must not be ventilated to contain the fire
C. The compartment shall be lined with fire resistant material and ventilation and droughts must be there so that any fire likely to occur will not progress beyond safe limits

questions.questionText: Lead acid batteries are stored in a:
options: A. Semi charged state to prevent deterioration of the battery by sulphation
B. Discharged state and have a longer shelf life
C. Charged state

questions.questionText: When large aircraft are employed, a hand pump is usually used for:
options: A. Ground servicing purposes
B. Lowering the landing gear in an emergency
C. Pressuring the oleo struts in the air

questions.questionText: To improve aerodynamic performance, modern aeroplane make use of surfaces that affect the airflow over the surface that could be:
options: A. Flaps
B. Spoilers and speed brakes
C. All of the above

questions.questionText: A supercharger is capable of maintaining sea level values of power upto a high altitude is called:
options: A. Ground boosted supercharger
B. Externally driven supercharger
C. Altitude boosted supercharger

questions.questionText: Component along plane of rotation
options: A. Torque
B. Thrust

questions.questionText: High energy ignition unit ignites
options: A. 4 times in one revolution
B. 60-100 times in one second
C. 60-100 time in one minute

questions.questionText: Limit load factors are based on the
options: A. Mean weight of aircraft
B. Max weight of aircraft
C. Max weight divided by lift
